{"step_by_step_thinking": "Peau d'orange in carcinoma breast is characterized by the appearance of skin changes resembling the peel of an orange. It is typically associated with inflammatory breast cancer, a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer. The skin changes in peau d'orange are caused by cutaneous lymphatic edema, which leads to swelling. The swelling can cause the hair follicles to become buried, resulting in the characteristic appearance. Based on the information provided in the documents, the most likely cause of peau d'orange in carcinoma breast is obstruction of sub-dermal lymphatics.", "answer_choice": "A"}
